practice_questions.question: Choose the comparative form: María es _____ alta que Ana (more)
practice_questions.explanation: Use 'más' + adjective + 'que' for 'more than' comparisons.

practice_questions.question: Select the correct form: Este libro es _____ interesante que ese (less)
practice_questions.explanation: Use 'menos' + adjective + 'que' for 'less than' comparisons.

practice_questions.question: Complete: Pedro es _____ alto _____ su hermano (as tall as)
practice_questions.explanation: Use 'tan' + adjective + 'como' for equality comparisons.

practice_questions.question: Choose the superlative: Es la casa _____ bonita del barrio
practice_questions.explanation: Use 'la/el/los/las' + 'más' + adjective + 'de' for superlatives.

practice_questions.question: Select: Mi hermana es _____ (older) que yo
practice_questions.explanation: 'Mayor' is the irregular comparative form for age (older).

practice_questions.question: Complete: Este problema es _____ (worse) que el anterior
practice_questions.explanation: 'Peor' is the irregular comparative form of 'malo' (worse).

practice_questions.question: Choose: La comida está _____ (better) hoy
practice_questions.explanation: 'Mejor' is the irregular comparative form of 'bueno' (better).

practice_questions.question: Select: Es el _____ (youngest) de la familia
practice_questions.explanation: 'Menor' is used for the youngest in a family context.

practice_questions.question: Complete: Esta película es _____ aburrida _____ la otra
practice_questions.explanation: Use 'tan' + adjective + 'como' for equal comparisons.

practice_questions.question: Choose: Son los estudiantes _____ inteligentes de la clase
practice_questions.explanation: Superlative form: 'los' + 'más' + adjective + 'de'.

practice_questions.question: Select: Mi coche es _____ rápido que el tuyo
practice_questions.explanation: Context suggests 'less fast than' - use 'menos'.

practice_questions.question: Complete: Es _____ difícil _____ pensaba
practice_questions.explanation: Use 'más de lo que' when comparing with a clause.

practice_questions.question: Choose: Ella es la _____ alta de todas
practice_questions.explanation: Superlative: 'la más' + adjective + 'de todas'.

practice_questions.question: Select: Este ejercicio es _____ fácil _____ el anterior
practice_questions.explanation: Equal comparison: 'tan' + adjective + 'como'.

practice_questions.question: Complete: Es el _____ (best) restaurante de la ciudad
practice_questions.explanation: 'Mejor' is the superlative form of 'bueno'.

test_questions.question: Choose the correct comparative: Juan es _____ inteligente que Pedro
test_questions.explanation: Use 'más' + adjective + 'que' for superiority comparisons.

test_questions.question: Select the superlative: Es la película _____ interesante del año
test_questions.explanation: Superlative structure: article + 'más' + adjective + 'de'.

test_questions.question: Complete: Mi hermano es _____ (older) que mi hermana
test_questions.explanation: 'Mayor' is the irregular comparative for age.

test_questions.question: Choose: Esta comida está _____ (worse) que ayer
test_questions.explanation: 'Peor' is the irregular comparative of 'malo'.

test_questions.question: Select: Ana es _____ alta _____ María
test_questions.explanation: Equal comparison uses 'tan' + adjective + 'como'.

test_questions.question: Complete: Es el _____ (youngest) de los hermanos
test_questions.explanation: 'Menor' is used for youngest in family contexts.

test_questions.question: Choose: Este libro es _____ (better) que el otro
test_questions.explanation: 'Mejor' is the irregular comparative of 'bueno'.

test_questions.question: Select: Es _____ complicado _____ esperaba
test_questions.explanation: Use 'más de lo que' when comparing with a clause.

test_questions.question: Complete: Son las casas _____ caras del barrio
test_questions.explanation: Superlative: 'las más' + adjective + 'del/de la/de los/de las'.

test_questions.question: Choose: Mi trabajo es _____ estresante que el tuyo
test_questions.explanation: Use 'menos' + adjective + 'que' for inferiority comparisons.

practice_questions.question: Choose the correct position: Una casa _____ (blanca/white)
practice_questions.explanation: Descriptive adjectives usually go after the noun: 'casa blanca'.

practice_questions.question: Select the correct order: A _____ man (good)
practice_questions.explanation: 'Bueno' becomes 'buen' before masculine singular nouns and goes before.

practice_questions.question: Complete: Una _____ mujer (great)
practice_questions.explanation: 'Grande' becomes 'gran' before singular nouns and means 'great'.

practice_questions.question: Choose: El _____ día (first)
practice_questions.explanation: 'Primero' becomes 'primer' before masculine singular nouns.

practice_questions.question: Select: Una mesa _____ (wooden)
practice_questions.explanation: Material adjectives go after the noun, often as 'de + material'.

practice_questions.question: Complete: Un _____ problema (bad)
practice_questions.explanation: 'Malo' becomes 'mal' before masculine singular nouns.

practice_questions.question: Choose: La _____ página (third)
practice_questions.explanation: Ordinal numbers usually go before the noun: 'tercera página'.

practice_questions.question: Select: Un coche _____ (red)
practice_questions.explanation: Color adjectives go after the noun: 'coche rojo'.

practice_questions.question: Complete: Una _____ idea (good)
practice_questions.explanation: 'Bueno' stays as 'buena' with feminine nouns and can go before for emphasis.

practice_questions.question: Choose: El _____ capítulo (last)
practice_questions.explanation: Ordinal adjectives like 'último' usually go before the noun.

test_questions.question: Choose the correct position: Una camisa _____ (azul/blue)
test_questions.explanation: Color adjectives go after the noun: 'camisa azul'.

test_questions.question: Select: Un _____ amigo (good)
test_questions.explanation: 'Bueno' becomes 'buen' before masculine singular nouns.

test_questions.question: Complete: Una _____ ciudad (great)
test_questions.explanation: 'Grande' becomes 'gran' before singular nouns meaning 'great'.

test_questions.question: Choose: El _____ mes (third)
test_questions.explanation: 'Tercero' becomes 'tercer' before masculine singular nouns.

test_questions.question: Select: Una casa _____ (stone)
test_questions.explanation: Material descriptions use 'de + material' after the noun.

test_questions.question: Complete: Un _____ día (bad)
test_questions.explanation: 'Malo' becomes 'mal' before masculine singular nouns.

test_questions.question: Choose: La _____ vez (first)
test_questions.explanation: Ordinal numbers go before the noun: 'primera vez'.

test_questions.question: Select: Un perro _____ (small)
test_questions.explanation: Size adjectives can go before or after; after is more common.

practice_questions.question: Choose the correct possessive: _____ libro (my)
practice_questions.explanation: 'Mi' is used before singular nouns for 'my'.

practice_questions.question: Select: _____ libros (my)
practice_questions.explanation: 'Mis' is used before plural nouns for 'my'.

practice_questions.question: Complete: _____ casa (your - informal)
practice_questions.explanation: 'Tu' is used before singular nouns for informal 'your'.

practice_questions.question: Choose: _____ hermanos (your - informal)
practice_questions.explanation: 'Tus' is used before plural nouns for informal 'your'.

practice_questions.question: Select: _____ coche (his/her/your formal)
practice_questions.explanation: 'Su' is used before singular nouns for his/her/your (formal).

practice_questions.question: Complete: _____ padres (our)
practice_questions.explanation: 'Nuestros' agrees with masculine plural 'padres'.

practice_questions.question: Choose: _____ madre (our)
practice_questions.explanation: 'Nuestra' agrees with feminine singular 'madre'.

practice_questions.question: Select: _____ amigos (your - plural)
practice_questions.explanation: 'Vuestros' agrees with masculine plural 'amigos'.

practice_questions.question: Complete: El libro es _____ (mine)
practice_questions.explanation: 'Mío' is the stressed possessive for masculine singular nouns.

practice_questions.question: Choose: La casa es _____ (yours - informal)
practice_questions.explanation: 'Tuya' is the stressed possessive for feminine singular nouns.

practice_questions.question: Select: Los coches son _____ (theirs)
practice_questions.explanation: 'Suyos' is the stressed possessive for masculine plural nouns.

practice_questions.question: Complete: _____ hermana (their/your formal)
practice_questions.explanation: 'Su' is used before singular nouns for their/your (formal).

practice_questions.question: Choose: Las ideas son _____ (ours)
practice_questions.explanation: 'Nuestras' is the stressed possessive for feminine plural nouns.

practice_questions.question: Select: _____ profesora (your - plural, Spain)
practice_questions.explanation: 'Vuestra' agrees with feminine singular 'profesora'.

practice_questions.question: Complete: Un amigo _____ (of mine)
practice_questions.explanation: After the noun, use stressed possessive 'mío' for masculine.
